programme.desc: Set in early 20th-century Montana, this is the tale of a Colonel and his three sons who compete for the affections of the same young woman.

programme.title: The Legend of Zorro
programme.desc: New father and husband Zorro wears his mask for justice when greedy land barons plot to keep California from becoming the 31st state in the U.S.

programme.title: Let's Do It Again!
programme.desc: In this 1953 musical remake of The Awful Truth, a recently-divorced couple try every way to make each other jealous.

programme.title: First Comes Courage
programme.desc: Beautiful Norwegian woman Nicole Larsen (Merle Oberon) is dedicated to the local resistance movement, and seduces Nazi officer Paul Dichter (Carl Esmond) in order to gain information that will help to defeat the Germans. Complicating matters for Nicole are both the difficulty of her loathsome undercover work and the appearance of an old flame, handsome English soldier Allan Lowell (Brian Aherne), who would like nothing more than to reunite with her.

programme.title: Meet the Stewarts
programme.desc: When a boy from modest means marries his rich, pampered finacé, squabbles over budget threaten to tear the lovebirds apart in this charming rom-com.

programme.title: The Trouble with Angels
programme.desc: A Reverend Mother faces an uphill battle to reform a pair of young, hard-to-reach troublemakers who’ve been wreaking havoc on her convent school.

programme.title: Oliver Twist
programme.desc: In this adaptation of the classic Charles Dickens novel, an orphan on the streets of London is welcomed into a household of trained pickpockets.

programme.title: The Long Gray Line
programme.desc: An Irish immigrant who found a home in the Army as a West Point instructor becomes very close to his pupils, one of whom is Dwight Eisenhower.

programme.title: The Mating of Millie
programme.desc: A businesswoman (Evelyn Keyes) asks a bachelor (Glenn Ford) to help her find a husband so she can adopt an orphan.

programme.title: It Happened to Jane
programme.desc: When a shipment of expired shellfish arrives to her New England lobstery, Jane Osgood decides to take a capitalist railroad tycoon to court.

programme.title: The Notorious Landlady
programme.desc: After falling for his charming landlady, an American diplomat in London learns that she's suspected of murder and tries to help her clear her name.

programme.title: Divorce American Style
programme.desc: A nouveau-riche L.A. couple decide to call it quits after 17 years of marriage, but alimony woes send the bachelor in search of a husband for his ex.

programme.title: The Fuller Brush Girl
programme.desc: Fired from her job as a switchboard operator, a daffy young woman tries her hand at door-to-door cosmetics sales only to get mixed up in a murder rap.

programme.title: Only Angels Have Wings
programme.desc: Rough and tough Geoff Carter (Cary Grant) runs a tiny airline that cannot afford to miss any flights, despite the dangers along many of the routes. When Bonnie Lee (Jean Arthur), a performer who is falling for him, sees that Geoff is preparing to fly in violent weather conditions, she takes measures to make him stay. She's successful in her attempt, and two of his employees are forced to make the flight for him -- but Bonnie may have been correct about the potential peril of that flight.

programme.title: His Girl Friday
programme.desc: A crafty editor for the Morning Post news uses every trick in the book to keep his fast-talking, ace reporter ex-wife from remarrying her new beau

programme.title: Three on a Couch
programme.desc: An artist hopes to move to Paris, but his psychiatrist fiancée fears abandoning her patients, so he dons various disguises to cure the lonesome women.

programme.title: What a Woman!
programme.desc: An author (Willard Parker) and a literary agent (Rosalind Russell) become involved after selling film rights to his racy book.

programme.title: Shopworn
programme.desc: After her release from a three-month prison sentence, Kitty Lane becomes an overnight musical sensation and renews her romance with David Livingston.

programme.title: The Wrecking Crew
programme.desc: Superspy, Matt Helm, with the help of agent Freya Carlson, travels to Denmark to find the mastermind behind the heist of a billion in US gold bullion.

programme.title: The Lone Wolf Takes a Chance
programme.desc: A former jewel thief (Warren William) is accused of murder after betting the police inspector that he can stay out of trouble for 24 hours.

programme.title: Fire Down Below
programme.desc: The long-standing bond between two small-time smugglers sailing around the Caribbean is threatened when a gorgeous siren seeks passage on their boat.

programme.title: The Amazing Mr. Williams
programme.desc: Homicide detective Kenny Williams (Melvyn Douglas) is so attached to his police work that his longtime fiancée, Maxine Carroll (Joan Blondell), wonders if he would rather solve a case than get married. When Maxine convinces the police captain (Clarence Kolb) to threaten Kenny with suspension, Kenny shows his dedication by accepting a case requiring him to dress as a woman. With a killer on the loose, Kenny must decide between his career obligations and his fiancée's wishes.

programme.title: How to Save a Marriage and Ruin Your Life
programme.desc: A dedicated bachelor takes it upon himself to save his best friend’s marriage by seducing his mistress, only to wind up in his own romantic conundrum.

programme.title: It Happened One Night
programme.desc: When a brash reporter starts trailing a runaway heiress on her bus trip from Florida to New York for a big scoop, can love be far behind?

programme.title: Twentieth Century
programme.desc: When down-on-his-luck Broadway impresario Oscar Jaffe (John Barrymore) meets his discovery and former flame, Lily Garland (Carole Lombard), on the glamorous 20th Century Limited train between Chicago and New York, he uses every scheme at his disposal to win the movie star back both professionally and romantically. However, Lily, along with her new beau, George (Ralph Forbes), and Jaffe's rival producer, Max Jacobs (Charles Levison), who hired Lily to star in his latest play, have other plans.

programme.title: His Girl Friday
programme.desc: A crafty editor for the Morning Post news uses every trick in the book to keep his fast-talking, ace reporter ex-wife from remarrying her new beau

programme.title: Lust for Gold
programme.desc: During the 1870s, the ruthless Jacob Walz (Glenn Ford) becomes very wealthy after locating a legendary Arizona gold mine and securing sole ownership by murdering his partner. Walz then travels to Phoenix, where he catches the attention of a beautiful and crafty woman named Julia Thomas (Ida Lupino), who has learned of his exploits. Eventually, Walz falls in love with Julia, unaware that she's already married to Pete (Gig Young), who is eyeing his fortune.

programme.title: Whirlwind Raiders
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) and his singing sidekick (Smiley Burnette) stop bogus Texas lawmen.

programme.title: Pecos River
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) and his singing sidekick (Smiley Burnette) catch mail robbers.

programme.title: Desert Vigilante
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) bags Mexican-border silver smugglers for Uncle Sam.

programme.title: Arizona
programme.desc: Phoebe Titus (Jean Arthur) is a tough-as-nails pioneer with dreams of starting a freight service in Tuscon, Ariz. Peter Muncie (William Holden), a vagabond passing through Arizona en route to California, takes a romantic interest in Phoebe and coaxes out her softer side. Just as their romance begins to blossom, Peter packs up and moves on. Though charming southerner Jefferson Carteret (Warren William) steps in to lend a hand, he may be plotting in secret to sabotage Phoebe's nascent business.

programme.title: Sierra Stranger
programme.desc: Jess Collins, a poor miner, helps Sonny chase off two men he calls claim jumpers. When he arrives in the nearby town, he learns Sonny is no good and everyone in town is against him.

programme.title: Hangman's Knot
programme.desc: Major Matt Stewart (Randolph Scott) leads a troop of Confederate soldiers on a raid, targeting a wagon that is transporting Union gold. All of the Union soldiers are killed except for one, who informs Stewart that the war had already ended a month ago. Stewart leads the troop into hiding, knowing they could face murder charges. After capturing a coach driven by nurse Molly Hull (Donna Reed), the soldiers try to evade a group of bandits chasing them to steal the gold.

programme.title: Comanche Station
programme.desc: When solitary cowboy Jefferson Cody (Randolph Scott) hears tales of a white woman living as a captive of the Comanche tribe, he rides deep into the tribe's territory to exchange goods for her freedom. As Cody escorts the captive woman away, he learns that she is Nancy Lowe (Nancy Gates), and that there is a sizable reward offered by her husband for her return. Cody and Mrs. Lowe must brave ruthless bounty hunters greedy for the reward, as well as the now-warring Comanches, to make it to safety.

programme.title: Cripple Creek
programme.desc: A federal agent (George Montgomery) and two colleagues infiltrate a gang of gold-rush gold smugglers.

programme.title: The Texican
programme.desc: Deputy Jess Carlin (Audie Murphy) leaves his Texas hometown in disgrace, framed by corrupt saloon owner Luke Starr (Broderick Crawford) for a crime he didn't commit. When his brother, muckraking newspaper editor Roy Carlin (Víctor Vilanova), is murdered after printing an exposé of Starr's crooked deals, Carlin returns home from the Mexican border town where he's been holed up and enlists his brother's fiancée (Luz Márquez) and saloon dancer Kit O'Neal (Diana Lorys) to bring Starr down.

programme.title: Decision at Sundown
programme.desc: Bart and sidekick Sam arrive in Sundown on the wedding day of town boss Tate Kimbrough, whom Bart blames for his wife's death years earlier.

programme.title: Go West, Young Lady
programme.desc: A vicious outlaw called Pecos Pete (Onslow Stevens) has long tormented the peaceful residents of a small frontier town. So these desperate people hire a dedicated new sheriff, Tex Miller (Glenn Ford), to bring this ruffian to justice. But, for all his determination, Tex is tricked by Pete and led into an ambush. Ultimately, it is the wily and brassy transplant Belinda "Bill" Pendergast (Penny Singleton) who uncovers Pete's true identity and plots a way to run him out of town once and for all.

programme.title: Gunmen From Laredo
programme.desc: A framed Texas rancher (Robert Knapp) escapes from prison for a showdown with a saloonkeeper (Walter Coy).

programme.title: The Nevadan
programme.desc: After fleeing a sheriff's escort to jail, an outlaw thief crosses paths with a mysterious stranger and a greedy rancher en route to his stash of gold.

programme.title: Masterson of Kansas
programme.desc: In the 1870s, Marshal Wyatt Earp (Bruce Cowling) calls upon Dodge City, Kan., Sheriff Bat Masterson (George Montgomery) to track down rancher Merrick (John Maxwell), who is accused of murder. But, thanks to some proof held by local Native American Chief Yellow Hawk (Jay Silverheels), Masterson realizes Merrick might be the victim of a frame-up. So, with the help of Earp and gunfighter Doc Holliday (James Griffith), Masterson sets out to find those who are really behind the killing.

programme.title: Laramie Mountains
programme.desc: The Durango Kid learns that crooked scouts are behind attempts to escalate a war between a local tribe and the cavalry.

programme.title: Savage Pampas
programme.desc: To tame the plains of Argentina, dominated by bandits and Indigenous warriors, an army captain brings in a party of women to keep his soldiers happy.

programme.title: The Gun That Won the West
programme.desc: Superior Springfield rifles help scouts (Dennis Morgan, Richard Denning) and the cavalry get forts built in Wyoming.

programme.title: Relentless
programme.desc: Framed for a murder he didn't commit, a cowboy hides with a traveling woman as he flees a sheriff and hunts for the real killer.

programme.title: 7th Cavalry
programme.desc: Returning to Fort Lincoln, Capt. Benson learns of Custer's defeat at the Little Big Horn. At the inquiry as Custer's officers blame Custer for the defeat, Benson tries to defend him. However, Benson was suspiciously absent at the time of the battle and is now despised by the troops. So when an order to retrieve the bodies from the battlefield arrives, Benson volunteers for the dangerous mission of returning back into Indian territory.

programme.title: Gunfighters
programme.desc: Brazos Kane, a gunslinger who's vowed to kill no more, goes to work for a land baron on a ranch, where he is unjustly accused of murder.

programme.title: Texas Cyclone
programme.desc: A traveling cowboy visits an unusual town where everyone assumes he is a man who was once presumed to be dead, including the man’s wife.

programme.title: 40 Guns to Apache Pass
programme.desc: A cavalry captain (Audie Murphy) rescues settlers and catches a corporal (Kenneth Tobey) selling rifles to Apaches.

programme.title: Saddles and Sagebrush
programme.desc: A rancher (Russell Hayden) joins an outlaw gang to figure out how to stop it.

programme.title: 3:10 to Yuma
programme.desc: Dan Evans (Van Heflin), a drought-plagued Arizona rancher, volunteers to take captured stagecoach robber and murderer Ben Wade (Glenn Ford) from Bisbee to Contention City, where the criminal will be put aboard the 3:10 train to Yuma for his trial. Accompanied only by the town drunk, Alex Potter (Henry Jones), Dan battles Wade's henchman (Richard Jaeckel), the murder victim's revenge-minded brother, and the temptation of the large bribe Wade offers in exchange for his freedom.

programme.title: Rockin' in the Rockies
programme.desc: Shorty Williams (Moe Howard) is put in charge of his cousin's ranch, but he is more concerned with becoming a prospector. He comes across two drifters (Larry Fine, Curly Howard) who just got lucky at the roulette table and befriends them as possible investors. Shorty also meets singer Betty (Gladys Blake) and her partner (Mary Beth Hughes) and convinces them to stay on the ranch along with the vagrants. Unfortunately, Shorty's cousin, Rusty (Jay Kirby), returns early and isn't pleased.

programme.title: Al Jennings of Oklahoma
programme.desc: Lawyer Al (Dan Duryea) and brother Frank (Dick Foran) turn to robbing banks and trains after Union troops raid their home.

programme.title: The Man From Colorado
programme.desc: In Colorado at the end of the Civil War, Col. Owen Devereaux (Glenn Ford), affected by four years of brutal bloodshed, orders the massacre of a Confederate unit, even as they try to surrender. Devereaux's friend and second in command, Capt. Del Stewart (William Holden), is the only one aware of the surrender attempt. Devereaux returns home to a hero's welcome and is appointed a judge, yet his irrational and angry behavior continues, affecting his fianceé, Caroline (Ellen Drew), as well as Del.

programme.title: The Texas Rangers
programme.desc: The Civil War has ended, the Union Army has pulled out, and now the Texas Rangers are needed once again to protect their state from harm. The newly reformed Rangers decide to take a chance by hiring a notorious outlaw Johnny Carver (George Montgomery). They offer the desperado amnesty for his previous crimes if he'll put his famous trigger finger to work for Texas. Carver agrees, but his new job won't be easy, as his old rival, the Sundance Kid (Ian MacDonald), is out for vengeance.

programme.title: Seminole Uprising
programme.desc: An Army lieutenant (George Montgomery) is ordered to go after Florida Indians in Texas.

programme.title: Secret Liaison
programme.desc: A woman travels from Los Angeles to Seattle to try to prevent her sister from going to prison for murder.

programme.title: The Suspect
programme.desc: Beth es una mujer a la que han acusado injustamente de matar a su marido. Todo el mundo cree que ella es culpable, incluida su hijastra, hasta que aparece Jerry, un investigador de una aseguradora que le da el beneficio de la duda. Juntos buscarán al auténtico culpable...

programme.title: The Odd Way Home
programme.desc: The oddest couple takes an unforgettable journey through the American Southwest, finding happiness in the unlikeliest of places and seeing in each other what no one else has seen before.

programme.title: Cowboy & Indiana
programme.desc: With new found hope, former world champion bull rider is given a dangerous shot to regain his former glory.

programme.title: The Wedding Contest
programme.desc: When a couple can't decide on a wedding theme, they hire two wedding planners to compete for the job.

programme.title: Courage
programme.desc: Jason Priestley stars in this inspirational adventure story about courage, love and the power of family.

programme.title: What We Do For Love
programme.desc: Sophie secures a job at the famous wellness firm but soon clashes with the chief life coach Jason.

programme.title: The Boxer and the Butterfly
programme.desc: A dancer and a boxer must team up for a big performance after a last minute drop out.

programme.title: From Italy with Amore
programme.desc: In the quest to find her dream man, Ariel meets Daniel who shows that food is the way to her heart.

programme.title: A Snapshot of Forever

programme.title: The Bouquet
programme.desc: Two estranged sisters set aside their differences to help their mother save her floral business.

programme.desc: Music exec Amanda clashes with brand rep Sam at a launch party, unaware she already met him online.

programme.desc: Teens band together to investigate the source of anonymous messages that threaten to expose their secrets.

programme.title: Paper Angels
programme.desc: The story of a family man whose life is changed by a simple expression of kindness and an abused boy who shows him the true meaning of Christmas.

programme.title: Cradle of Lies
programme.desc: Five years ago Melissa went into labor while in a coma. She has just awoken with no information about her baby girl, and so her frantic search begins.

programme.title: Vote One For Love
programme.desc: Candace is unexpectedly tasked with helping her former high school rival win a mayoral race.

programme.desc: The chef of a traditional Italian restaurant clashes with a tech innovator who plans to turn her beloved eatery into a trendy dining destination.

programme.desc: An ex-con kung fu expert helps the police find a serial killer who targets martial arts masters.

programme.desc: In this swashbuckling classic, the legendary hero fights to rid England of the tyranny of Prince John and win the love of the beautiful Maid Marian.

programme.title: The Roaring Twenties

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: When a past suspect is back in court on appeal, Booth and Brennan work to prove he is guilty once and for all; Brennan becomes a suspect.

programme.desc: After Brennan is accused of murder, her father (Ryan O'Neal) helps her hide from the FBI; Booth and the team think an evil tech genius (Andrew Leeds) manipulated evidence to implicate Brennan.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: A powerful divorce lawyer with a lot of enemies is murdered; the three-month separation between Booth and Brennan starts to take its toll.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: When a man claims to have dreamed of a murder before it happened, Horatio sends Natalia under cover to investigate him.

programme.title: CSI: Miami

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The CSIs try to determine who is after a fisherman after he narrowly escapes death.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The team must fight for the life of a pregnant woman and her baby after she is assaulted.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: When a sugar refinery explodes, the CSIs make a shocking discovery about one of the employees.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: After a fire hydrant washes away evidence, the team must re-create a bizarre double murder.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A young roller derby star is found dead in a locker room; the team investigates the murder.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: A Senate committee questions the members of the BAU team; a familiar face may help keep the team united.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU team investigates a series of murders in Oklahoma; Reid gives JJ and Prentiss the cold shoulder.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: After a mass murder at an Internet security company, evidence indicates that the person responsible is not a typical serial killer; Prentiss is required to complete recertification training.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: A killer targets survivors of a high-school massacre, who have gathered for a reunion; Hotch fears that his son is being bullied.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: A series of children are abducted from troubled women in St. Louis; Rossi's first wife shares shocking news.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team investigates when multiple bodies are found in a national forest; Rossi faces an agonizing decision.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU investigates when bodies are exposed by tornadoes in Kansas; pressure at work affects J.J. at home.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: A woman in Garcia's survivors' support group goes missing on the seventh anniversary of her daughter's disappearance.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team investigates when an apparent mass suicide takes place at a military academy; Morgan and Hotch clash.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The investigation of a series of bludgeonings in Philadelphia leads the team to the city's boxing scene; Hotch connects with a fellow runner while training for the triathlon.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: A series of murders makes the team wonder if a notorious killer has returned; Reid wonders if he could be doing more with his abilities.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: A serial rapist resurfaces in Houston and assaults his past victims; Prentiss attempts to overcome last year's trauma.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Lasalle's brother, Cade, needs the team's help when he becomes a murder suspect -- and cannot remember what happened; Lasalle is determined to prove Cade's innocence, despite the wealth of evidence against him.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Baitfish murders a person close to the team in order to send a message to Pride; a citywide hunt for the elusive criminal takes place.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Pride has suspicions about a mole; new intelligence comes to light that indicates a breach at the ports.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Pride and the team must go on a dangerous undercover mission to retrieve a stolen missile and prevent an attack.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A blogger dedicated to exposing government corruption is murdered; during the investigation, it is revealed that a war crime may have occurred during a humanitarian effort in Bolivia.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: When a highly regarded Navy pilot is killed after crashing a new, high-tech jet at an air show, the team must determine if it was human or mechanical error.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The NCIS team investigates when a Navy drone pilot is murdered after using a black market drone to obtain military surveillance.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: When an Australian Royal Navy Lieutenant is murdered in New Orleans, Special Agent Naomi Parsons (Kate Beahan) is sent to work with Special Agent Pride.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: A teen discovers a dismembered, headless body in a pool of purple water; the team struggles to find enough evidence to locate a killer until getting insight from Zack, who studies the case at his psychiatric facility.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Booth and Brennan investigate when the remains of a disliked office manager are found in a building elevator shaft; Angela and Hodgins try to figure out their altered relationship.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Skeletal remains with remnants of breast implants are found in the Chesapeake Bay; when the body's lower half is discovered, the team realizes that initial assumptions about the victim may be wrong.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Booth and Brennan investigate when the remains of a renowned artist are found in an impounded junkyard car; a woman connected to Angela becomes a suspect in the case.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: A con man misleads the team during a murder investigation; Booth's younger brother, Jared, takes a job at the Pentagon; Brennan agrees to go on a date with Jared to a White House function.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: While en route to China to identify prehistoric anthropological remains, Booth and Brennan are called upon to solve a murder in midair when the flight attendant discovers a fully cooked human body in the plane's microwave.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Brennan and Booth investigate when a skull and other skeletal remains are found in a nationally protected wooded preserve; Brennan's recently acquitted father (Ryan O'Neal) finds a job as a teacher.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: A shallow grave holds the remains of conjoined twins; Booth and Brennan infiltrate a circus community after they discover that the twins were jugglers there.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: A man and his son discover a frozen body in a pond; Booth gets advice from one of his hockey idols.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Brennan and the team get a phone call from the Grave Digger, who informs them that Booth has been buried alive with only 24 hours of oxygen.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Dave Cutler, Goodman's Land's amorous postman, is found almost decapitated near the common early one morning. Newspaper girl Holly Reid (Kate Maberly) tells Barnaby that she heard music playing faintly nearby. Barnaby and Troy are aided in their investigations by local WPC Jay Nash (Gillian Kearney).

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The appearance of a headless horseman at Quitewell Hall foreshadows a number of deaths amongst an aristocratic family. In the midst of a Civil War re-enactment the family relive their own historic battles with their hostile neighbours. But what is the truth about the DeQuettevilles - and the ghostly rider?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a barrister is killed in Midsomer, suspicion falls on convicted murderer Grady Felton. Grady has just returned to the village where he committed the murder years ago amid much anger from locals. But Grady has a solid alibi. Barnaby suspects he is working with an accomplice - until Grady himself is targeted in an arson attack.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The murder of a journalist has chilling echoes of a 1960s horror film starring Midsomer's own Stella Harris. When Stella's more famous sister returns after a 40-year family rift, the killings escalate, each of them reminiscent of a movie plot. Is life - and death - imitating art?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: As darkness covers Midsomer Stanton during a total eclipse of the sun, amateur astronomer Jeremy Harper is killed by a blow to the head with a meteorite. Barnaby and Jones soon discover intrigue, sexual tension and academic rivalry are rife among the star-seeking community.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Harriet Farmer wakes up after being in a coma since the night she tried to elope. Soon afterwards, a killer strikes members of a chess club. Could the attack which left Harriet for dead a year ago be linked to moves on a chess board? And where is her boyfriend Finn?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A woman is crushed to death with a giant round of cheese at the home of the world-famous Midsomer Blue. Secret and controversial plans to modernise the dairy are revealed while rumours about private lives of the parents cause a row at the prestigious local prep school. As other people linked to the dairy meet agonising deaths, long-held secrets start to emerge...

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: No one could suspect that a prestigious golf club would be the setting for murder, but when one of the major members is found dead, bludgeoned to death in a thicket next to the 13th hole, Barnaby and Jones try to determine what made him leave the fairway. It seems the club has a rift between the snobbish members, and local villagers, the latter only allowed onto the course for a few hours a week. Before long, another member turns up dead, and the detectives soon find the club has a hidden history, involving gambling, illegal money lending and assault, prompting the pair to determine if a club member, or one of its staff, is responsible for the deeds.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A newly discovered masterpiece by landscape artist Henry Hogson causes a stir when it is auctioned for £400,000 - just hours before its former owner is tortured and killed. When another Hogson is stolen, Barnaby decides to become an expert on the Midsomer painter, with the help of art teacher Matilda Simms (Susannah Harker). He soon realises the paintings are not what they seem - but the death toll is rising.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Former secret agent Geoffrey Larkin arrives in Midsomer Parva and stays at Allenby House, a country mansion run by former spies Sir Malcolm Frazer (Benjamin Whitrow), his son Nicky (Peter Davison) and Nicky's wife Jenny (Alice Krige) as a safe house. Geoffrey is soon gashed to death after a cricket match in Midsomer Parva, and the locals blame the 'beast of Midsomer'. However, Barnaby - a former spy himself - soon realises that the killing has links to Allenby House and Cold War Berlin, but is initially thrown off the case by MI6. But when a further murder occurs MI6 Agent Glen Jarvis (Neil Stuke) asks Barnaby back on the case.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Midsomer University science fellow and cycling enthusiast George Jeffers (David Haig) threatens to make public a problem with his state-of-the-art invention Kernel Logic, but American software boss Clinton Finn fears he will lose millions if the truth comes out. When a schoolteacher is killed in a hit-and-run, Barnaby suspects Jeffers was the intended target. The subsequent murder of a fellow cyclist (Philip Jackson) brings the involvement of fellow University associates (Jonathan Cecil and Jim Norton) into sharper focus.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In the peaceful village of Little Worthy, Bob Moss was about to open up his beloved model village, when he found a gruesome extra attraction. Young local, Richard Tanner, had been stabbed in the side and his corpse tied down like Gulliver in Lilliput. Barnaby and Jones wonder who wanted him dead, but when the woman he was secretly meeting is killed during the village's Crazy Craft race, the pair have to delve in and discover who might be lying and hiding secrets.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A cat burglar is on the loose, one known as "the Creeper", but the wave of burglaries he or she have committed, seem to have finally led to murder, when David Roper (Rik Mayall) is found smothered in his bed on the Chettham family estate. Yet Barnaby and Jones learn he may have been planning to write a book that could have been quite uncomfortable for someone, leading the pair to determine whether members of the Chettham family, or their friends, were responsible.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A sleep-walking school teacher (Nancy Carroll) starts to believe she has slit the throats of her mentor (Tim Wylton) and a local handyman man in her sleep, but her friends (Paola Dionisotti and Monica Dolan) are not convinced that she is the culprit, nor is Barnaby. A local philanthropist (Paul Chapman) and his social-climbing wife (Suzanne Burden) are planning the annual Frobisher night - but will it go without a hitch, and can they identify the killer?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A woman is killed after receiving threatening letters, setting off a chain of murders for DCI Barnaby to investigate.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In the village of Midsomer Wellow, someone is killing off the bell ringers of the parish church, in the week before a big bell-ringing competition. One young woman on the team is even shot dead in the churchyard on her wedding day.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Some of the residents of Midsomer Worthy are trying to prevent James Harrington from turning Setwale Woods into a housing estate. Led by a solicitor, Bernadette Sullivan, and a local farmer, Simon Bartlett, who also happen to be having an affair, they haven't had much success in court. When Bartlett's wife Victoria is found dead in the woods, Barnaby and Troy must first determine is if her murder is related to the planned development or something as yet unknown. The information provided by two inquisitive children, who see the investigation as a fascinating game, proves invaluable in solving the crime.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: An investigation of a car fire and a bludgeon murder lead Barnaby and Troy to investigate the members of a local reading club which has an agenda that goes beyond books.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby investigates the murder of a boy during a traditional annual race at an exclusive private school but meets with resentment.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: New DCI John Barnaby arrives in Midsomer and is bemused by the quaint villages and their quirky residents. But when a local DJ is crushed to death at a traditional girls' boarding school, he soon discovers that murder and deception are never far away. As the death toll rises, could Barnaby's first case also be his last?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The reclusive lives of elderly eccentrics William and Mary Bingham (Edward Fox and Phyllida Law) comes under police scrutiny when a social services investigator (Jeff Rawle) is murdered. Barnaby and Jones must unearth generations of family secrets and decipher astronomical charts to find the killer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a young woman is dressed like a bride and drowned in a bath, it triggers a spate of ghoulish wedding-themed murders in Great Worthy. The case takes Barnaby and Jones to a donkey sanctuary, a heritage steam railway and a pub run by an ex-copper and former brothel madam. With the serial killer still at large, could history be repeating itself?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Jones goes undercover at the Oblong Foundation after one of the cult's young female members disappears suddenly. But he and Barnaby soon start digging into an old case involving the death of a couple in a boat explosion.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In Midsomer Mow, the gruesome discovery of a farmer's eviscerated body in an ancient stone circle is made just days before the spring equinox.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A VAT inspector goes missing as he hunts for an illicit cider still responsible for brewing The Beast, a potent local hooch. At the Midsomer Abbas spring fayre which celebrates its friendship with Midsomer Herne, Barnaby and Jones sample the local cider, while temperance preacher Norman Grigor calls on residents to repent of their drunken ways. Suddenly, Barnaby is violently ill as the body of missing man Peter Slim is found floating in the cider vat. Meanwhile Samuel Quested (Warren Clarke), the traditionalist mayor of Midsomer Abbas, seeks to revive the ancient rite known as 'The Stag'.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Jones investigate the cloistered world of Midsomer Priory when a nun is strangled to death. The detectives uncover a complex mystery involving holy orders, teenage romantic liaisons, African art and missing antique silver as the community is forced to open its doors to 21st-century policing.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A row between keen birdwatchers in Midsomer-in-the-Marsh turns nasty when their president is killed. Patrick Morgan met his death while hoping to sight a rare bird, but is his obsession with ornithology to blame - or something more sinister?

programme.desc: Danny makes an old Ford Econoline look so cool that in the end, two buyers get into a bidding war for it. Danny can score big, but only if he can let his baby go.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: It's the dead heat of summer and this season the stakes are higher than ever. From mountaintop to river's bottom, six crews will take on one of America's deadliest jobs.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: As the summer heats up, so do the men of the mountain. Rygaard breaks in its greenhorns, while Jay Browning takes a gamble on a new yarder operator.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: After an ill-fated road trip, Jimmy and James Smith arrive in Florida to tackle the dangerous black water of the American South, only to realize they're in way over their heads.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The forest fights back, as a careless mistake at Browning threatens to take out DJ and Cody. At Rygaard, Gabe gives his greenhorns an ultimatum: shape up or ship out.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Logging country is under siege. Melvin's gung-ho attitude puts the crew in danger. Rygaard's greenhorns fight for a permanent spot on the crew.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Tempers flare as the logging season hits the rails. Jay Browning battles allergic shock, while Gabe Rygaard sends one of the greenhorns packing.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: At Rygaard, one of the greenhorns goes AWOL and Gabe has him on the chopping block. But he's not the only one--several of the loggers face the ax.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The loggers struggle to get back on track after losing a man. At Browning, a weak cable threatens to kill half the crew.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby's desperate dash for cash is halted when he crashes in the swamp. A monster gator stalks the S&S boys, pushing Jimmy to his breaking point.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Jimmy and James come face-to-face with the 12-foot gator that has stalked them for weeks. In the swamps of Louisiana, Shelby goes solo on a challenging mission.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Lisa decides to be fact-based in Placentia, Calif., inadvertently complicating international relations; Ivy and his son conjure up a locker with some mysterious sports equipment; Rene won't be taken advantage of, allowing him to record a nice win.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy searches for high-end lockers; Rene and Casey clash over purchases; things get hairy for Jarrod and Brandi; Darrell plays old-fashioned pranks on his rivals.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy changes his game and pursues a locker with collectibles; Mary looks for quick-sale items; Darrell calls upon a friend for assistance when he is tested by local Mission Hills buyers.

programme.title: Storage Wars

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: To prove once and for all who rules the river AND the boardroom, Willie and Jase revive their childhood rivalry and go head-to-head in a fishing competition with the added challenge of having to sell their catch.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: While out duck hunting, Willie, Jase, and Uncle Si stumble across what redneck's consider nature's most prized succulent treasure--a beehive dripping with wild honey.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie finds out that his daughter Sadie has a new boyfriend, he wants to get to know him, while instilling some fatherly fear--Robertson style.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie decides to expand the Duck Commander brand into the winemaking industry and buys a vineyard...sight unseen.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase and Si embark on a turkey hunt for the annual Robertson men vs. Robertson women cook-off to create a feast of fresh wild game. With Phil's discerning palate as judge, the teams pull out all of the stops.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase volunteers to take the Duck Commander RV out on pick up, but neglects to mention to Willie, he's taking Si, Martin and Jep along for a road trip.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Phil, Willie and Ms. Kay attempt to produce a cooking video for their fans.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Phil decides to teach his grandkids the value of a hard day's work by building a football field and culminating in a family football game. But Robertson vs. Robertson competition is further sparked.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After a big order comes in Willie pushes the Duck Commander team to meet the tight deadline, so Jase and the warehouse guys come up with a plan to build a conveyer belt.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Brotherly competition gets the best of Willie when he ditches his kids' career day to go play golf with Jase. Stepping in for Willie, Phil and Si show up at the school and become the teachers' worst nightmare.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After blowing up one of Phil's dangerously antiquated duck blinds, the Robertson boys hatch a wild plan to build a luxury duck blind in the sky. Meanwhile, Ms. Kay and the Robertson women hold a yard sale.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase feels being COO of Duck Commander entitles him to a new office. But when Willie refuses, Jase hatches a plan to build one anyhow. Willie takes Miss Kay and the grandkids to the petting zoo.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: It's duck blind maintenance time again and the boys have discovered the waterline is low. At the levee, they realize this is the work of Phil's bucktoothed arch nemesis...THE BEAVER.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: It's the 40-year anniversary of Duck Commander and this celebration is a redneck Robertson style shindig. To top off the event, Willie decides to construct the world's largest duck call to be revealed at the party.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: To prove once and for all who rules the river AND the boardroom, Willie and Jase revive their childhood rivalry and go head-to-head in a fishing competition with the added challenge of having to sell their catch.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie finds out that his daughter Sadie has a new boyfriend, he wants to get to know him, while instilling some fatherly fear--Robertson style.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie decides to expand the Duck Commander brand into the winemaking industry and buys a vineyard...sight unseen.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase and Si embark on a turkey hunt for the annual Robertson men vs. Robertson women cook-off to create a feast of fresh wild game. With Phil's discerning palate as judge, the teams pull out all of the stops.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase volunteers to take the Duck Commander RV out on pick up, but neglects to mention to Willie, he's taking Si, Martin and Jep along for a road trip.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: It's all hands on deck for the Duckmen when an old high school nemesis challenges them to a good old fashion race... at the local lawn mower competition. But Willie and the guys soon find out that this sport is nothing short of high octane.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: With Sadie's (Willie's daughter) driver's license test fast approaching, she finds herself in dire need of lessons.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After Willie's son (John Luke) leaves Willie's pickup in the driveway with a bone-dry gas tank, Willie and Korie decide that it's time to get the kid his own car.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Duck Commander assembly room gets an unexpected shakeup when a disgruntled Si decides to quit his job. But when Willie hires a replacement that clashes with the duck call room, Jase and the guys quickly become equally miserable at work. Meanwhile, Si turns to Phil for work out on the land turning a routine levee repair into a complete disaster.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie finds his office in shambles and alerts the authorities that the warehouse has had a break in. But soon Willie discovers that the culprit was his brother Jase, who needed supplies for an early morning frog hunt.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When a heat wave envelops West Monroe the air conditioning unit at the Duck Commander warehouse goes down, turning the duck call assembly room into a boiling sweatshop.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After Korie decides the junk piles in the Duck Commander warehouse are beginning to reach critical mass, she calls on Willie and the guys to do a little company spring-cleaning. But the discovery of an old Ping-Pong table deep within the clutter quickly turns the chore into an all day table tennis tournament. Meanwhile, Uncle Si realizes that he's many years overdue for an appointment with the local eye doctor and ventures out for some new glasses.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After attending a local radio show as a guest, Willie sees an opportunity to host a show of his own. When the station gives him the opportunity, Willie makes the mistake of bringing Uncle Si on the air with him.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Jase, Si and the guys from the duck call room take a field trip to a brand new local donut shop and quickly find out who amongst them can eat the most delicious treats.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie receives a special gift from a Japanese business associate - a "priceless" samurai sword, which Willie keeps out of the hands of Jase and the guys.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie pushes his work force too far after implementing new "motivational work tactics," and the guys rise up against him and go on strike.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: A compilation of the best scenes from all 11 seasons of A&E's hit series Duck Dynasty.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When NASCAR sensation Clint Bowyer pays a visit to the Duck Commander warehouse, Willie and the guys are fired up to spend the day hanging out with the professional racecar driver. But too much enthusiasm about the celebrity's mode of transportation turns into a drag race showdown between Willie and Clint. Phil and Si have their hands full fixing Ms. Kay's barbecue when a trip to the outdoor grill store turns disastrous.

programme.desc: Willie receives a special gift from a Japanese business associate - a "priceless" samurai sword, which Willie keeps out of the hands of Jase and the guys.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie pushes his work force too far after implementing new "motivational work tactics," and the guys rise up against him and go on strike.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: A compilation of the best scenes from all 11 seasons of A&E's hit series Duck Dynasty.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When NASCAR sensation Clint Bowyer pays a visit to the Duck Commander warehouse, Willie and the guys are fired up to spend the day hanging out with the professional racecar driver. But too much enthusiasm about the celebrity's mode of transportation turns into a drag race showdown between Willie and Clint. Phil and Si have their hands full fixing Ms. Kay's barbecue when a trip to the outdoor grill store turns disastrous.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: It's all hands on deck for the Duckmen when an old high school nemesis challenges them to a good old fashion race... at the local lawn mower competition. But Willie and the guys soon find out that this sport is nothing short of high octane.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: With Sadie's (Willie's daughter) driver's license test fast approaching, she finds herself in dire need of lessons.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After Willie's son (John Luke) leaves Willie's pickup in the driveway with a bone-dry gas tank, Willie and Korie decide that it's time to get the kid his own car.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Duck Commander assembly room gets an unexpected shakeup when a disgruntled Si decides to quit his job. But when Willie hires a replacement that clashes with the duck call room, Jase and the guys quickly become equally miserable at work. Meanwhile, Si turns to Phil for work out on the land turning a routine levee repair into a complete disaster.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie finds his office in shambles and alerts the authorities that the warehouse has had a break in. But soon Willie discovers that the culprit was his brother Jase, who needed supplies for an early morning frog hunt.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When a heat wave envelops West Monroe the air conditioning unit at the Duck Commander warehouse goes down, turning the duck call assembly room into a boiling sweatshop.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After Korie decides the junk piles in the Duck Commander warehouse are beginning to reach critical mass, she calls on Willie and the guys to do a little company spring-cleaning. But the discovery of an old Ping-Pong table deep within the clutter quickly turns the chore into an all day table tennis tournament. Meanwhile, Uncle Si realizes that he's many years overdue for an appointment with the local eye doctor and ventures out for some new glasses.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After attending a local radio show as a guest, Willie sees an opportunity to host a show of his own. When the station gives him the opportunity, Willie makes the mistake of bringing Uncle Si on the air with him.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: It's Willie's turn to play Santa Claus at the local church this year but Uncle Si crashes the party and the event goes south in a hurry. Meanwhile, the family gathers at Phil and Miss Kay's house to celebrate the holidays in true redneck fashion.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Tomorrow is the opening day of Duck Season and the men are carrying on their tradition of camping on the Robertson Land the night before... including Willie.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Gearing up for his high school reunion, Willie realizes that he could stand to lose a few pounds. Jase and Korie set out to help him drop some weight and the strenuous battle of man-versus-waistline begins.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The guys learn from Willie that John Luke is going through his first break up. In order to make him feel better the men decide to take John Luke hunting for nutria, and impart their relationship wisdom.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When the warehouse guys new office pet (a lizard) escapes, they try all they can in order to catch the wily reptile. Proving impossible, the guys finally decide to bring in the big guns to help trap it--Mr. Phil Robertson.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: With Willie out-of-town, the guys decide to flake off work and leave to brush up the duck blinds on the Robertson land. While out, Si believes he spots what he thinks is the infamous "Black Panther,"

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie and Jase invite Korie and Missy along on a deer hunt because they believe their wives have become too "city."

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: During Duck Commander's "Casino Night" party for the sale of their 5 millionth duck call, Si Robertson wins the grand prize of $2000 and decides to buy a massage chair for the duck call room.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Sadie, has a homecoming dance coming up, but Willie doesn't approve of her dress selection. Willie decides to take Sadie out to find her a new "appropriate" dress.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Though Jase lost his wedding ring long ago, Missy decides it's time for Jase to replace it with a new one. When Jase is duck hunting, once again, he loses the ring and is forced to come up with a game plan of how to approach and appease Missy.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie calls the team into work on a Saturday afternoon for an HR training session, but the seminar quickly dissolves from unproductive to complete disaster.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave must find and transform a 1967 GTO for a secret client.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The final details on the 1967 GTO come together to create a masterpiece.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and the team start a one-of-a-kind build with a 1964 Ford Ranchero.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave struggles to find the perfect name for the Ranchero build.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A father-daughter team wants a little sister for the '65 Safari Bus.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: An old build is back for an interior revamp and a new name.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave tries to envision what the Hummer H2 might look like in the future.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The team tries to correct flaws in a Mercedes Gullwing kit car.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A '41 Chevy rolls in for a trunk-lid fix, but things go south quickly.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The Mercedes Gullwing build finally comes to an epic conclusion.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and the crew swap the chassis of a 1955 Chevrolet Nomad.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A show in Stockton wants Dave to be a judge and to present a special award.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A '63 Corvette gets an LSX engine, a larger transmission and new paint.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The crew stretches a '62 Corvette and makes some other improvements.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Vinnie Massaro is back looking to build the biggest, baddest Mopar ever.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Metal work on the '67 Coronet is done, so now it's on to the paint booth.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The 1941 Chevy is finished in the metal shop and ready for paint.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave is challenged restoring a 1964 Cadillac to its original condition.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and the Kindig team add a tubbed bed and slivered Camaro bumpers to a classic Chevrolet C/K C-10.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The guys need to shake down a 1962 Corvette and make some design adjustments to a '55 Mercedes Gullwing; Kevin hunts for new ideas and rare finds in Los Angeles.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A road warrior from Alaska arrives at the shop to add some improvements to an already solid build; to enhance performance, a new exhaust and tips are custom fabricated as well as a new set of wheels, tires and a custom interior.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A simple yet classy Pontiac Tempest arrives for a ground-up build, but things get complicated after the car is completely stripped.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The Pontiac Tempest build continues as bodywork is completed and Dave has designed a killer new color; Kevin shows off his powder-coating skills on a custom chassis.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave restarts work on a 1948 GMC truck that has been sitting in the back of the shop for three years.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and Kevin take the '67 Coronet, '55 Gullwing and '63 Corvette to a car show in Columbus, Ohio, where they will compete for street rod of the year.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave loves anything VW, and he finds a deal for a rare Transporter pickup that is too good to pass up. With a few modifications, he will finish the build, but then his real dilemma begins - whether to keep it or auction it.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A car from Kindig’s past arrives back in the shop for an engine upgrade.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A Karmann Ghia aficionado wants some very specific upgrades for his new purchase. Custom trim, wheels, lowered stance, new paint and new upholstery are some of the items that will give this car a new lease on life.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The pieces that have arrived at the shop are allegedly for a Nova, but the only thing recognizable is the body; the challenge will be to piece car back together and get the body ready so the client can paint it himself.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A client wants his '48 GMC to be Dave's baddest build ever, but when he throws Dave a curveball, it threatens the entire project. Celebrating 20 years in business, Kindig-It hosts a custom car show featuring a slew of past builds.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and the crew start on a 1966 Corvette, but his client doesn't want the color to be anywhere close to its original green.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The client is on board with the chosen shade of green, and the car moves into the paint booth.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A past client returns with a 1965 Mustang Fastback, and though he likes the stock look, he wants to upgrade the drivetrain, instrumentation and as many modern amenities as possible; the assembly team gets a crash course in engine tuning.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: An active-duty serviceman and his father are finally ready to finish their 1951 Ford pickup.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The 1951 pickup is painted and ready for final assembly.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Fixing a '32 Ford that caught fire after an accident.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave designs a Mustang for the ages to compete in the Optima Challenge; the build includes a new front facia and hood and redesigning the rear end.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The 1965 Mustang makes its way through the metal shop and is now ready for paint and final assembly; making it function will test even the Kindig crew.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave has decided that the time is right to design his own concept car from scratch; it's a huge job that involves all the different departments in the shop.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: All the Concept Corvette's elements are built and assembled, but Dave needs to find a buyer; a rock 'n' roll icon brings his '34 Ford coupe to the shop.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A simple repaint of a 1964 Corvette careens into much more after Dave upsells the client on a couple of design features, and the crew finds some damage underneath the original paint; the owner of an iconic Ford GTX1 tasks Dave with solving a dilemma.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: An abandoned 1967 C10 that has been sitting for years has been sold to a client who wants a few new touches, but closer inspection reveals more work is needed.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave convinces the client to make the 1967 C10 truck into a convertible; Kevin takes on a new personal project with a Cadillac Escalade.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The engineering on the convertible C10 works in theory, but making it work in practice is the next step; a team brings in a replica 1967 Cobra with a bad engine.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Of all the different years and generations of the VW Bug, there is one that stands out among the rest -- the Hebmüller; there are maybe 200 of them left, so in addition to being hard to find, they are truly the holy grail of VWs.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The build continues, and the challenge is to keep what makes the car a Hebmueller intact, while taking bold steps to turn it into a hot rod. Dave keeps the traditional two-tone exterior, but modifying it to an automatic is a huge test for the shop.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Normally when Kindig-It Design attends a car show, their cars are the ones being judged. But this time around, Dave and Kev hold the keys and will have to select the top 10 builders out of the hundreds of cars that arrive for the show.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave's clients have owned a car since they got married 25 years ago and want it restored so they can enjoy it for another 25. While the shop isn't really into straight restorations, adding some custom pieces and paint makes them "say yes" to the pro.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave is thrilled with the latest build, while KevDogg is barely lukewarm; Dave has done double-cab VWs, Bugs and Karmann Ghias, but now he is taking on something completely different, and even more rare.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Matching the two-tone paint job is the challenge of the day as the '53 Barn Door Deluxe build carries on; custom trim, a new, more powerful engine, 22 windows and a custom interior all come together to make this surprise worth the wait.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and the guys at Kindig-It proved they could execute Dave's vision of his production Corvette, but now that a few have sold, they have to get them completely finished.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and the team put the finishing touches on the first-ever Kindig CF Corvettes to complete a lifelong dream; however, the clients argue about who will get the first one, all in advance of a once-in-a-lifetime debut at SEMA.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and Kevin, who have been an absolute treat for automotive enthusiasts for years, come back to the SEMA show with something special on their minds.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A Beatles fanatic challenges Dave to paint a modern Rolls-Royce to match the car John Lennon commissioned in the late 1960s.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and Kev take the show as far east as they have ever gone and head to Lake George, New York, for the Adirondack Nationals; the town shuts down for the car show, attracting some of the best on the east coast.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A 1970s Pantera is an iconic sportscar, but once Dave gets his hands on it, the style will never be the same; the client has given Dave free rein to change the car as he sees fit, but has one request: he is 6'4" and can't comfortably get in it.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave must find and transform a 1967 GTO for a secret client.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The final details on the 1967 GTO come together to create a masterpiece.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and the team start a one-of-a-kind build with a 1964 Ford Ranchero.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave struggles to find the perfect name for the Ranchero build.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A father-daughter team wants a little sister for the '65 Safari Bus.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: An old build is back for an interior revamp and a new name.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave tries to envision what the Hummer H2 might look like in the future.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The team tries to correct flaws in a Mercedes Gullwing kit car.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A '41 Chevy rolls in for a trunk-lid fix, but things go south quickly.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The Mercedes Gullwing build finally comes to an epic conclusion.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and the crew swap the chassis of a 1955 Chevrolet Nomad.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A show in Stockton wants Dave to be a judge and to present a special award.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A '63 Corvette gets an LSX engine, a larger transmission and new paint.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The crew stretches a '62 Corvette and makes some other improvements.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Vinnie Massaro is back looking to build the biggest, baddest Mopar ever.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Metal work on the '67 Coronet is done, so now it's on to the paint booth.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The 1941 Chevy is finished in the metal shop and ready for paint.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave is challenged restoring a 1964 Cadillac to its original condition.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and the Kindig team add a tubbed bed and slivered Camaro bumpers to a classic Chevrolet C/K C-10.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The guys need to shake down a 1962 Corvette and make some design adjustments to a '55 Mercedes Gullwing; Kevin hunts for new ideas and rare finds in Los Angeles.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A road warrior from Alaska arrives at the shop to add some improvements to an already solid build; to enhance performance, a new exhaust and tips are custom fabricated as well as a new set of wheels, tires and a custom interior.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A simple yet classy Pontiac Tempest arrives for a ground-up build, but things get complicated after the car is completely stripped.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The Pontiac Tempest build continues as bodywork is completed and Dave has designed a killer new color; Kevin shows off his powder-coating skills on a custom chassis.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave restarts work on a 1948 GMC truck that has been sitting in the back of the shop for three years.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and Kevin take the '67 Coronet, '55 Gullwing and '63 Corvette to a car show in Columbus, Ohio, where they will compete for street rod of the year.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave loves anything VW, and he finds a deal for a rare Transporter pickup that is too good to pass up. With a few modifications, he will finish the build, but then his real dilemma begins - whether to keep it or auction it.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A car from Kindig’s past arrives back in the shop for an engine upgrade.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A Karmann Ghia aficionado wants some very specific upgrades for his new purchase. Custom trim, wheels, lowered stance, new paint and new upholstery are some of the items that will give this car a new lease on life.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The pieces that have arrived at the shop are allegedly for a Nova, but the only thing recognizable is the body; the challenge will be to piece car back together and get the body ready so the client can paint it himself.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A client wants his '48 GMC to be Dave's baddest build ever, but when he throws Dave a curveball, it threatens the entire project. Celebrating 20 years in business, Kindig-It hosts a custom car show featuring a slew of past builds.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and the crew start on a 1966 Corvette, but his client doesn't want the color to be anywhere close to its original green.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The client is on board with the chosen shade of green, and the car moves into the paint booth.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A past client returns with a 1965 Mustang Fastback, and though he likes the stock look, he wants to upgrade the drivetrain, instrumentation and as many modern amenities as possible; the assembly team gets a crash course in engine tuning.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: An active-duty serviceman and his father are finally ready to finish their 1951 Ford pickup.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The 1951 pickup is painted and ready for final assembly.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Fixing a '32 Ford that caught fire after an accident.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave designs a Mustang for the ages to compete in the Optima Challenge; the build includes a new front facia and hood and redesigning the rear end.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The 1965 Mustang makes its way through the metal shop and is now ready for paint and final assembly; making it function will test even the Kindig crew.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave has decided that the time is right to design his own concept car from scratch; it's a huge job that involves all the different departments in the shop.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: All the Concept Corvette's elements are built and assembled, but Dave needs to find a buyer; a rock 'n' roll icon brings his '34 Ford coupe to the shop.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A simple repaint of a 1964 Corvette careens into much more after Dave upsells the client on a couple of design features, and the crew finds some damage underneath the original paint; the owner of an iconic Ford GTX1 tasks Dave with solving a dilemma.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: An abandoned 1967 C10 that has been sitting for years has been sold to a client who wants a few new touches, but closer inspection reveals more work is needed.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave convinces the client to make the 1967 C10 truck into a convertible; Kevin takes on a new personal project with a Cadillac Escalade.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The engineering on the convertible C10 works in theory, but making it work in practice is the next step; a team brings in a replica 1967 Cobra with a bad engine.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Of all the different years and generations of the VW Bug, there is one that stands out among the rest -- the Hebmüller; there are maybe 200 of them left, so in addition to being hard to find, they are truly the holy grail of VWs.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The build continues, and the challenge is to keep what makes the car a Hebmueller intact, while taking bold steps to turn it into a hot rod. Dave keeps the traditional two-tone exterior, but modifying it to an automatic is a huge test for the shop.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Normally when Kindig-It Design attends a car show, their cars are the ones being judged. But this time around, Dave and Kev hold the keys and will have to select the top 10 builders out of the hundreds of cars that arrive for the show.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave's clients have owned a car since they got married 25 years ago and want it restored so they can enjoy it for another 25. While the shop isn't really into straight restorations, adding some custom pieces and paint makes them "say yes" to the pro.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave is thrilled with the latest build, while KevDogg is barely lukewarm; Dave has done double-cab VWs, Bugs and Karmann Ghias, but now he is taking on something completely different, and even more rare.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Matching the two-tone paint job is the challenge of the day as the '53 Barn Door Deluxe build carries on; custom trim, a new, more powerful engine, 22 windows and a custom interior all come together to make this surprise worth the wait.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and the guys at Kindig-It proved they could execute Dave's vision of his production Corvette, but now that a few have sold, they have to get them completely finished.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and the team put the finishing touches on the first-ever Kindig CF Corvettes to complete a lifelong dream; however, the clients argue about who will get the first one, all in advance of a once-in-a-lifetime debut at SEMA.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and Kevin, who have been an absolute treat for automotive enthusiasts for years, come back to the SEMA show with something special on their minds.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A Beatles fanatic challenges Dave to paint a modern Rolls-Royce to match the car John Lennon commissioned in the late 1960s.
